sources.title: Dangerous Passage (1944) CRIME DRAMA
sources.description:
Stars: Robert Lowery, Phyllis Brooks and Charles Arnt
Director: William Berke

Joe Beck leaves Central America so that he can return to Texas and collect a large inheritance, but he picks a dangerous ship on which to travel.

sources.title: Dangerous Passage (1944) American film noir directed by William Berke
sources.description:
While living in Central America, Joe Beck receives word that his grandfather has passed away and left him $200,000, but faces an attack and flees on a ship. Onboard, he uncovers schemes to steal his inheritance and hide the crew's criminal activities.

metadata.Plot: While living in Central America, Joe Beck receives word that his grandfather has passed away and left him $200,000. Beck prepares to travel to Galveston, Texas to claim his inheritance, with the important papers that he will need. When he is assaulted soon afterward, he changes plans and takes a ship leaving that night. Also on board is Nita, who herself seems to be in a hurry to leave port. Beck receives a number of veiled threats and warnings, and then is almost killed by an accident on deck. Beck soon realizes that he is facing two serious problems: an attempt to defraud him of his inheritance, and another plan to stop him from finding out what the ship's crew is up to.
metadata.Actors: Robert Lowery, Phyllis Brooks, Charles Arnt
